articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Azerbaijan's defence ministry said on Saturday that Armenian forces had fired on its troops overnight, and that Azerbaijan army units took "retaliatory measures".
articles.title: Azerbaijan says Armenian forces fired on its troops

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: A 16-year-old Palestinian boy was shot dead by Israeli forces on Saturday near the occupied West Bank city of Hebron, Palestinian health officials said.
articles.title: Teenager shot dead by Israeli forces, Palestinian health officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain recorded its hottest day of 2023 so far on Saturday, with provisional data showing a high of 33.2 degrees Celsius (91.8 degrees Fahrenheit) at London's Kew Gardens.
articles.title: British heatwave brings hottest day of 2023 so far

articles.author: Katya Golubkova
articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has explained the release of treated water from the Fukushima nuclear plant to the sea to the G20 leaders who gathered in New Delhi for a two-day summit on Saturday, an official with Japan's foreign ministry said.
articles.title: Japan PM Kishida spoke about Fukushima water release with G20 leaders

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police deployed water cannon to disperse climate activists protesting on a highway in the Netherlands on Saturday to demand an end to government subsidies for the fossil fuel industry.
articles.title: Police use water cannon as climate activists block Dutch highway

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A former British soldier suspected of terrorism offences who escaped from prison earlier this week was recaptured in London on Saturday, police said.
articles.title: UK police arrest escaped terrorism suspect

articles.author: Jay Ereno
articles.description: The Philippines has completed a supply mission for troops stationed in a rusty World War Two-era ship, but not without a usual cat and mouse chase with Chinese vessels in the South China Sea.
articles.title: In cat and mouse game, Philippines resupplies troops in South China Sea atoll

articles.author: Ahmed Eljechtimi
articles.description: A powerful earthquake struck Morocco's High Atlas mountains late on Friday, killing at least 296 people, destroying buildings and sending residents of major cities rushing from their homes.
articles.title: Powerful earthquake kills 'at least' 296 in Morocco, govt says

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Charges against Donald Trump’s onetime chief of staff Mark Meadows over efforts to reverse the results of the 2020 presidential election will not be heard in federal court, a sign that similar bids by the former U.S. president and his co-defendants to move the criminal case to a more favorable venue will fail.
articles.title: Mark Meadows fails in bid to move Georgia election case to federal court

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Lee, a powerful Category 3 storm, was expected to move well north of Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands this weekend but could cause dangerous beach conditions on the U.S. East Coast beginning on Sunday, the U.S. National Hurricane Center said on Saturday.
articles.title: Hurricane Lee expected to move north of Puerto Rico but still dangerous
